intro: Aulospermum bethelii, commonly known as Bethel's aulospermum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white to pale yellow. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open habitats. Aulospermum bethelii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
